linkedContent: the Idea is not, always “beyond being” (epekeina tes ousias), as Telos of infinite determinability of Being, it’s being’s openness to the light > it is the light of light, sun of the visible sun, a hidden sun, no doubt what a Plato muted by Platonism tells us about

content: in Husserl there’s a “Platonism” of eidos or Idea not even in Plato (except in literalness of his myths & pedagogy)
linkedContent: in Husserl there’s a “Platonism” of eidos or Idea not even in Plato (except in literalness of his myths & pedagogy)

content: in criticizing psychologism & in “the return to the things themselves,” “Husserl urged getting rid of the spectrum of the soul’s faculties and all the vestiges of classic substantialisms”
linkedContent: in criticizing psychologism & in “the return to the things themselves,” “Husserl urged getting rid of the spectrum of the soul’s faculties and all the vestiges of classic substantialisms”

content: Teleological Reason precedes philosophical sense-investigation which awakened Reason to itself > every self-awakening (naissance à soi) of a latent intention is a rebirth (radical, creative)
linkedContent: Teleological Reason precedes philosophical sense-investigation which awakened Reason to itself > every self-awakening (naissance à soi) of a latent intention is a rebirth (radical, creative)

content: Husserl: philosophy’s innate Reason was previously in state of nocturnal obscurity
linkedContent: Husserl: philosophy’s innate Reason was previously in state of nocturnal obscurity

content: Logos (always has form of a Telos) is not the real transcendence but the ideal Pole for bringing about transcendental subjectivity itself
linkedContent: Logos (always has form of a Telos) is not the real transcendence but the ideal Pole for bringing about transcendental subjectivity itself

content: [like Hegel like Husserl] Logos is the pure movement of its own historicity, goes beyond “Fact” as the “ready-made” of history
linkedContent: [like Hegel like Husserl] Logos is the pure movement of its own historicity, goes beyond “Fact” as the “ready-made” of history

content: phenomenological attitude, attention for the “future of a truth which is always already announced”
linkedContent: phenomenological attitude, attention for the “future of a truth which is always already announced”

content: for Husserl, there’s nothing outside pure historicity of passage of Speech, “Logos and the Telos are nothing outside the interplay (Wechselspiel) of their reciprocal inspiration” > Absolute is Passage
linkedContent: for Husserl, there’s nothing outside pure historicity of passage of Speech, “Logos and the Telos are nothing outside the interplay (Wechselspiel) of their reciprocal inspiration” > Absolute is Passage

content: “method is not the neutral preface or perambulatory exercise of thought, rather, it is thought itself in the consciousness of its complete historicity”
linkedContent: “method is not the neutral preface or perambulatory exercise of thought, rather, it is thought itself in the consciousness of its complete historicity”

content: for Husserl, speech is historical because it is always already a response, responsibility means shouldering a word one hears spoken > look after the advance of sense
linkedContent: for Husserl, speech is historical because it is always already a response, responsibility means shouldering a word one hears spoken > look after the advance of sense

content: every return to the origin, an audacious move toward the origin (circulation, anticipation)
linkedContent: every return to the origin, an audacious move toward the origin (circulation, anticipation)

content: re: Husserl, Absolute is Passage, is dangerous, l’Absolu d’un Danger, for if light of sense is only through passage, light can be lost along the way (inauthenticity)
linkedContent: re: Husserl, Absolute is Passage, is dangerous, l’Absolu d’un Danger, for if light of sense is only through passage, light can be lost along the way (inauthenticity)

content: Husserl’s method: bring [passage] to consciousness, Selbstbesinnung, Verantwortung, avoid risk of inauthenticity, loss of Speech > light
linkedContent: Husserl’s method: bring [passage] to consciousness, Selbstbesinnung, Verantwortung, avoid risk of inauthenticity, loss of Speech > light

content: phenomenology terminates as philosophical propaedeutic for every philosophical decision [i.e. “ontological” question cannot stem from phenomenology as such] : this propaedeutic is an ideal sense, announced as infinite, phenomenology will always be its jurisdiction in its explicit anticipation of the end of its itinerary
linkedContent: phenomenology terminates as philosophical propaedeutic for every philosophical decision [i.e. “ontological” question cannot stem from phenomenology as such] : this propaedeutic is an ideal sense, announced as infinite, phenomenology will always be its jurisdiction in its explicit anticipation of the end of its itinerary

content: to pass from question “how” to question “why” (“why is there any historical factuality?”) we must exhaust question of historicity’s sense and historicity as sense > the “why,” the ontological question, owes its seriousness to a phenomenological certainty, arises only out of a teleological affirmation, i.e. out of freedom
linkedContent: to pass from question “how” to question “why” (“why is there any historical factuality?”) we must exhaust question of historicity’s sense and historicity as sense > the “why,” the ontological question, owes its seriousness to a phenomenological certainty, arises only out of a teleological affirmation, i.e. out of freedom

content: in going out from self to self of the Absolute of Living Present present, intentionality is the root of historicity, historicity is sense
linkedContent: in going out from self to self of the Absolute of Living Present present, intentionality is the root of historicity, historicity is sense

content: only phenomenology stripped Fact of its materiality [sense can always not be incarnated?]
linkedContent: only phenomenology stripped Fact of its materiality [sense can always not be incarnated?]

content: Derrida asks: why would there be any history instead of nothing?
linkedContent: Derrida asks: why would there be any history instead of nothing?

content: could there be any philosophy if consciousness of delay was not primordial and pure
linkedContent: could there be any philosophy if consciousness of delay was not primordial and pure

content: this phenomenological delay, the alterity of absolute origin can only be recognized in my Living Present, reduction is pure thought as delay
linkedContent: this phenomenological delay, the alterity of absolute origin can only be recognized in my Living Present, reduction is pure thought as delay

content: delay is thus philosophical absolute, and absolute origin in general
linkedContent: delay is thus philosophical absolute, and absolute origin in general

content: [Derrida “affirms” phenomenology after “savaging” it] “how can we lament that phenomenology is not an ontology”
linkedContent: [Derrida “affirms” phenomenology after “savaging” it] “how can we lament that phenomenology is not an ontology”

content: primordial consciousness of delay can only have the pure form of anticipation
linkedContent: primordial consciousness of delay can only have the pure form of anticipation

content: re: Husserl’s Origin…, delay is the philosophical absolute, all methodic reflection begins in the consciousness of another previous, possible, and absolute origin
linkedContent: re: Husserl’s Origin…, delay is the philosophical absolute, all methodic reflection begins in the consciousness of another previous, possible, and absolute origin

content: “access to Being and Being’s arrival must always already be contracted [stricture] or drawn together when phenomenology begins by claiming the right to speak (droit à parole)” > prescribing historicity for Being avoids simple misfortune of delay: phenomenology alone can open absolute subjectivity of Sense to Being-History, as auto-temporalization of Living Present
linkedContent: “access to Being and Being’s arrival must always already be contracted [stricture] or drawn together when phenomenology begins by claiming the right to speak (droit à parole)” > prescribing historicity for Being avoids simple misfortune of delay: phenomenology alone can open absolute subjectivity of Sense to Being-History, as auto-temporalization of Living Present

content: impossibility of resting in simple maintenance [nowness] of a Living Present, the absolutely absolute origin always other in its self-identity, Absolute is present only in being deferred-delayed (différant), this impotence is given in a primordial and pure consciousness of Difference, a difference that announces its form with apriori security > gives all factual profusion
linkedContent: impossibility of resting in simple maintenance [nowness] of a Living Present, the absolutely absolute origin always other in its self-identity, Absolute is present only in being deferred-delayed (différant), this impotence is given in a primordial and pure consciousness of Difference, a difference that announces its form with apriori security > gives all factual profusion

content: thus Difference as Thought as pure certainty > transcendental: “such a certainty never had to learn that Thought would always be to come”
linkedContent: thus Difference as Thought as pure certainty > transcendental: “such a certainty never had to learn that Thought would always be to come”
